text: Tragic news out of Hong Kong that 22 year-old Chow Tsz-lok has died after apparently fleeing tear gas from police. My condolences to the family and all Hong Kong protestors. His death should immediately be investigated. #StandWithHongKong

Our fight is not between workers who make $10 an hour and those who make $20 an hour.

Our fight is between the millions of Americans struggling just to get by and the handful of corporations and multibillionaires who hold obscene amounts of wealth and power.

Today in 1966, Edward W. Brooke became the 1st popularly-elected African American senator. He co-wrote the Civil Rights Act of 1968, which prohibits housing discrimination, and is one of the reasons why my parents could move into my childhood home. Grateful for his leadership. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EI4vemmX0AAexN3.jpg
3 years ago today, Trump won the presidency by just 77,000 votes. In 360 days when we head to the polls, we can’t forget that—if we turn out to vote, we will make Trump a one term president.

I’m still waiting. Voters have a right to know who is buying access and recognition with the possible future leaders of our party—and how much it costs. We can talk all we want about how to get big money out of politics, but nothing will change unless we start leading the way.

The person who is trustworthy in very small matters is also trustworthy in great ones; and the person who is dishonest in very small matters is also dishonest in great ones.

Luke 16:10

I was proud to attend the opening of the #US Embassy in Jerusalem in 2018. Under @realDonaldTrump’s leadership, the U.S. has signaled to the world that we are a true and reliable friend and ally and that #Jerusalem is the eternal and undivided capital of #Israel. https://twitter.com/USAmbIsrael/status/1192754718973530114 QT @USAmbIsrael 24 yrs ago today, the Jerusalem Embassy Act became law. It recognized Jerusalem as the undivided capital of Israel & required the move of the US Embassy to Jerusalem. The recognition was ignored & the move was delayed by 3 prior presidents. But not this one — thank you @POTUS!

For over 40 years, the Indian Child Welfare Act has protected Native American children and kept them connected with their families and heritage. The attacks on #ICWA are utterly misguided and as I've done in the past, I stand with tribes as they fight to keep children safe.

Working parents agree: it’s time we ensure they have peace of mind that their children are in a safe, enriching environment after school. My bill would do just that. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1192575960295596032/img/wp1v6nj7oT09Hk72.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1192575960295596032/vid/426x240/y6yNEHtaTtNztGzb.mp4?tag=13
